items.title: One of my teeth is so ______ that it is going to be missing soon
—How about taking a walk?
You are supposed to write your composition every ______ line.

The reason for my absence was ______ I had fallen ill.
This is the university ______.
It was in this house ______ the important meeting in history was held.
She looked so honest that we all regarded her story ______.
Mrs. Brown as well as her children ______ to go Paris on holiday next week.
He is training hard, hoping to ______ a new world record.
___in the arguments about the morality of artificially reproducing life is the fact that，at present, cloning is a very inefficient procedure.
We’ll___ what our country expects of us.
The writer has listed why cloning is not feasible to be ___on humans.
He was a charming and ___host whose house was an___rendezvous( 集合的)  of the great.
I think the chief thing that ___ me about Mr. Bush was his kindness and humor.
Mrs. Clinton was always neatly and quietly dressed ___ her age and status.
We discussed only such problems  ___ concerned everyone of us.
After the ___of 17 British passengers, Mr. Blair continued to express his concern over the safety of the other passengers still on board the hijacked airliner.
The “quality” newspapers are often held ___ as an example of impartial journalism.
At the age of 14, he went to his uncle's farm, where he had lessons on botany  ___  .
He can't drive a car. Let  ___fly an aero-plane.
The boy said to his mother in an ___ voice that she shouldn't have blamed him.
___how the splendid Maya Culture disappeared all of a sudden from the earth, it remains a mystery hard to solve.
In the era of market economy, the concept of “Consumer First” should be ___by manufacturers.
He's widely known more  ___a poet than  ___a novelist.
The football match was held over until further notice ___the continual rain.
The rain was heavy and  ___the land was flooded.
Another issue ___the new republic is the problem of the education of its citizens.
A window in the kitchen room was ___; there was rubbish everywhere and the clock had been stolen.
Knowing that her son was suffering from a ___ disease, the mother cried her eyes out.
Some people consider it unwise to ___themselves in a quarrel between husband and wife.
I have just come here to see if I can be___ to you.
Imagine ___with someone who never stops ___practical jokes on you.
The Old Man and the Sea and many other novels ___ Ernest Hemingway the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1954.
Those who had moved to America under the ___that America was paved with gold everywhere started to regret their decision.
___change your mind，please give us a call.
When ___, he denied  ___ anything illegal.
See you later. Jenny. I'm glad ___ with you for six months.
The girl in the snapshot was smiling sweetly, her long hair___________in the breeze.
___from the European continent, England had been in close contact with the outside world.
The actors have to ___ before they appear in front of the audience.
Quite a lot of people watch TV only to ___time.
John was never particular ___ the food his wife served.
The designing of a satellite in the heavy environment is  ___an easy job.
Edward is the boy  ___I think scored the winning point for the basketball team.
It is often more difficult to find trained men than ___for scientific research.
John is a good student, ___his best subject.
___great was the destruction that the South took decades to recover.
You ought not to ___him the news that day.
Hot metal ___as it grows cooler.
Do you have a preference ___a particular food?
By now most freshmen have grown so used to university life that they have forgotten all those___ about the university they originally had.
Many people want to buy it because.___. the price is reasonable; ___ , it's rather durable.
items.A: A．on one side, on the other side
items.C: C．on the one hand, on the other hand
items.D: D．in one part, in the other part

items.title: The proposal ___we start doing the experiment two days earlier has been agreed upon by all.
Spring  ___, we may look forward to better weather.

___from the balcony when he saw a policeman approaching him.

___, I cannot agree with him on the matter.

___editor and ___publisher of this magazine is a learned man from Britain.
Many a white-collar worker___to return to the easy days of university or college.
Would you like him to paint it blue?I'd rather he  ___it green.
James dressed himself up as a plumber before leaving the house lest he  ___.
He struck the girl in the face and she fell to the ground ___.
I think it quite essential that your child ___ a foreign language at school.
She woke up from the nightmare ___ .
Is there any___in your company?
The old man  ___the boy on his knees.
Voices of argument were ___as the two motorists became more bad-tempered.
Don't take him for a friend; he's ___a bully.
She was exhausted and in no___for dancing.
During foggy weather trains are late  ___ .
The paint is still wet___.
items.A: A．Don't he sure to touch it.
items.B: B．Not be sure to touch it.
items.C: C．Be not sure to touch it.
items.D: D．Be sure not to touch it.

items.title: Who will be in charge of your team?We'll elect ___ .

It's high time you ___us the truth.
If I___to do the experiment, I would do it some other way.

We___it without your help.
___in the crash, he won't participate in the race.

items.A: A．Rarely have I seen this before.
items.B: B．Rarely before have I seen this.
items.C: C．Rarely have I seen before this.
items.D: D．Rarely I have seen this before.

items.title: I suppose she is not serious,___ ?

Whatever is worth ___ at all is worth ___well.

___change your mind, please give me a call.
